title: (x) techno sans on Swedish national soccer jersey - Aura {Yves}
content:
Hey there professionals...

Do any of you recognize the font on this shirt?

:o) Thanks

| Attachment | Size |
| --- | --- |
| [SwedenHSSNo.10.0506c.jpg](http://web.archive.org/web/20140307094343/http:/typophile.com/files/SwedenHSSNo.10.0506c.jpg) | 40 KB |
author: TheMark

comments.content: Dafont has a version – [http://www.dafont.com/colo-colo-umbro-200.font](http://web.archive.org/web/20140307094343/http:/www.dafont.com/colo-colo-umbro-200.font "http://www.dafont.com/colo-colo-umbro-200.font") – though the M is different.
Yikes that is heinous. You'd think a nation as design savvy as Sverige could do better.

Yes, that IS so terrible. I can dig into deeper with this, cause I know I have read about it somewhere, who designed these shirts (I dont believe it’s a swede at all but the clothing company that produces the clothes). When these sweaters were first seen, almost anyone I know felt it was an embarrasing bad design.

I guess the football-lobbyists havent understood what design is all about. cos I never seen a good swedish national clothes outfit in modern ages yet... and I am swedish... (but doesn’t play football)

If I find the article I will post it here, so whoever did it can be ashamed ;-)

\> I guess the football-lobbyists havent understood what design is all about.

Just remember the 2006 World Cup Logo.

<cite>You’d think a nation as design savvy as Sverige could do better.</cite>

I'm surprised they can design at all, what with all the hot Scandinavian distractions bouncing around in their teeny bikinis.

I _knew_ I'd seen it somewhere -- it's [Aura](http://web.archive.org/web/20140307094343/http:/www.t26.com/fonts/Aura) by [E-lan Ronen.](http://web.archive.org/web/20140307094343/http:/www.t26.com/fonts/designer/656-E-lan-Ronen)
